channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe downloads continue to rise, global COVID-19 cases top 3.6 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to retreat as Wall Street slides

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state has only 52 active cases as premier discusses options to reopen cafes and restaurants

item.description: The ruling removes a critical legal hurdle to the coalition government the right-wing Netanyahu and centrist Benny Gantz plan to swear in next week.
item.title: Netanyahu cleared by court to form government despite corruption charges

item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle honoured their son's first birthday by sharing an adorable video of the Duchess of Sussex reading one of his favourite books.
item.title: Meghan Markle reads baby Archie a story on his first birthday

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The men were taken to Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital with four in critical condition and the other in a serious condition.
item.title: Five workers flown to Brisbane with severe burns after coal mine 'gas' blast

item.description: US President Donald Trump cast doubt on a trade deal with China and worrying jobs figures send Wall Street lower.
item.title: Wall Street slides on Trump trade talk, jobs figures

item.description: Trump's handling of the pandemic and his falling poll numbers has forced his campaign to shift from "Keep America Great" back to "Make America Great Again."
item.title: Trump reboots 2020 message to focus on post-virus era, not crisis

item.description: The leader of the world's biggest asset manager had a stark message for a private audience: As bad as things have been for corporate America in recent weeks, they're likely to get worse.
item.title: BlackRock's Fink delivers grim outlook for corporate America

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: In a blow to hopes of rapid recovery once lockdowns are wound back, the lost economic ground will not be fully regained until at least 2022.
item.title: 'A recession of historic proportions': Europe's economic hit will be long-lasting

item.description: The world economy is facing 'very, very unusual' pressures as it emerges from lockdowns, says Robert Skidelsky.
item.title: World is facing a rare 'inflationary depression,' says economic historian

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australian suspicions have been raised about who is pushing a dossier promoting the theory that the coronavirus was created in a Wuhan laboratory.
item.title: Australian concern over US spreading unfounded claims about Wuhan lab

item.description: Scientists found almost 200 recurrent genetic mutations of the new coronavirus, which they say shows how it is adapting to its human hosts as it spreads.
item.title: Coronavirus spread swiftly around world from late 2019, study finds

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Mike Pompeo said the Trump administration was not certain about the origins of the coronavirus outbreak, but there is "significant evidence" it began in a lab.
item.title: 'Enormous evidence? Show us': US, China clash over coronavirus origins

item.description: A day after the Trump administration said it was preparing to wind down its coronavirus taskforce within weeks, the US President says the taskforce "will continue on indefinitely".
item.title: Trump reverses course, says he will keep US coronavirus taskforce 'indefinitely'

item.description: The airport services subsidiary of Dubai's Emirates Group warned its exclusion from the scheme had put 4500 jobs at risk and given an unfair advantage to its competitors.
item.title: Emirates reviews Australian airport operations after JobKeeper snub

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: Victoria Cross recipient has been referred by federal police to Commonwealth Director of Public Prosecutions to face possible charges for alleged war crimes.
item.title: Ben Roberts-Smith may face war crimes charges after AFP probe

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Councils that choose not to pass rate increases onto their communities will have the option of applying the increases in future years, under reforms proposed by the NSW government.
item.title: NSW councils to be given more flexibility over rates

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Lawyers for asylum-seekers in detention will ask federal authorities to release some of them due to fears of coronavirus.
item.title: Asylum seekers lodge claim to address detention virus fears

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The huddle is out, so too high fives and the ruffling of bowlers' hair, as part of social distancing measures to be in place when cricket returns.
item.title: 'New norm': How social distancing will affect on-field celebrations

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: The K League will become one of the first football competitions around the world to return on Friday night - and Australians will be able to watch it.
item.title: Game on: Optus seals domestic deal for Korean league days before kick-off

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The Rugby Australia directors baulked because Peter Wiggs was asking them to put aside due process and give the CEO job to a close friend.
item.title: Why Wiggs' grand plans failed to win over those who mattered most

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Among other suggestions in the project, artist Janet Laurence would like us to have a chat with our plants.
item.title: DIY art event invites all comers outside the box

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian will face pressure to dump Andrew Constance from her cabinet.
item.title: 'Distraction at worst possible time': Knives out for Andrew Constance

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, May 7

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The entrepreneur, who was synonymous with some of the city's most palatial waterfront homes, was imprisoned in Nevada for two years for his part in a fake biofuel credits scheme.
item.title: Former jailed developer Nati Stoliar back on Sydney real estate scene

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: A new app will allow workers to report unsafe workplaces directly to WorkSafe NSW without having to disclose their identity.
item.title: 'Immediately report it': new app for dobbing in unsafe workplaces

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Competition regulator's boss Rod Sims says he is keeping a close eye on Qantas and its promised cut-price post-pandemic fares.
item.title: ACCC to ensure reborn Virgin not 'killed at birth' by cheap airfares

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: It comes as a survey of almost 1200 GPs found 99 per cent were now offering consultations via phone or video.
item.title: Health Minister wants telehealth to continue after COVID-19 pandemic

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The university sector warns 38 per cent of research positions are at risk because of lost revenue from international students.
item.title: Tens of thousands of university research jobs at risk from funding blow

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Western Port Bay residents have launched an urgent appeal to push back an assessment of AGL's contentious plan for a floating gas import terminal at Crib Point.
item.title: Victoria urged to halt AGL's floating gas terminal approval bid

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: A huge donation to fund its shift online and Rachel Griffiths coming on board as ambassador give MIFF a renewed sense of purpose post cancellation.
item.title: MIFF 68½: it's the Melbourne Film Festival, but not as you know it

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The business-focused challenger bank has pushed through the $1 billion valuation mark after closing its third funding round
item.title: Judo Bank revels in unicorn status as investors tip in another $230m

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A ramp-up in infrastructure spending will feature as part of the Morrison government's post-virus economic recovery plan.
item.title: Infrastructure rebuild to form part of post-virus recovery plan

item.description: For decades the citizens of Australia and other advanced economies had declining trust in their governments. The global pandemic has changed that.
item.title: Trust is back – and it's governments we're putting our faith in

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: The COVID-19 crisis presents an opportunity for the nation to better separate federal and state responsibilities.
item.title: We don't need a federal education minister: Re-imagining our federation

item.description: The financial failure of Carriageworks offers a chilling warning of what the arts scene in a post-COVID-19 Sydney may look like.
item.title: Struggling arts can bloom again if creatives survive

item.description: How do I deal with feeling socially awkward while video conferencing?
item.title: Zooming out of a conference call – am I being rude?

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: After his brother was murdered, Ahmad 'Rock' Ahmad's life fell apart, the District Court has heard.
item.title: 'Don't bother, he's dead': raids, debt and shock after brother's execution in Sydney

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Turbans 4 Australia have so far distributed five tonnes of non-perishable food items across Sydney to international students made vulnerable by the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Sydney restaurants and relief groups step in to help international students

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Rail horror: 7 die, 99 injured; the great leap forward, and teachers’ strike: no talks
item.title: In the Herald: May 7, 1990

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: Here are five books by young writers, to freshen up your reading habits during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Fresh voices: Five books by young Australian writers

item.dc:creator: Caroline Zielinski
item.description: Studies show nine out of 10 teens aren’t doing enough physical activity during normal times. In isolation, it pays to get creative.
item.title: Motivating kids to stay active during the lockdown

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: These greats from the decade that brought us the 'New Hollywood' are at your streaming fingertips.
item.title: Top five: Essential '70s movies you can stream now

item.dc:creator: Daniel Lane
item.description: 25 years ago, a 51-year-old grandmother named Maggi swam competitively with the Bondi Icebergs, becoming the first woman to do so in the club's history.
item.title: From the Archives, 1995: First woman swimmer races with Bondi Icebergs

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 7, 2020

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Dubai's ruler, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, has had a poor run in the past few months.
item.title: Sheikh gets a profit bolt despite the pandemic

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Cedar Meats workers arriving for the early shift last Friday had no idea they were about to be told their workplace was the site of a major COVID-19 outbreak.
item.title: 'We all eat together': Cedar Meats worker tells of fear and uncertainty
